value.title: Federal agencies concerned face masks will thwart facial recognition tech
value.excerpt: The US Department of Homeland Security has raised concerns internally that face masks meant to protect against the spread of COVID-19 may interfere with facial recognition technology, The Intercept reported.

value.title: After George Floyd, French police face fresh scrutiny over alleged brutality
value.excerpt: "J'etouffe!" It's French, for "I'm suffocating" or "I can't breathe," and it was repeated seven times by a man in January as he was being pinned down by three police officers and as another filmed, near the Eiffel Tower in Paris.

value.title: Amazon, Google, Microsoft sued over photos in facial recognition database
value.excerpt: The plaintiffs allege that the tech giants used people's pictures obtained without permission to train their technologies.

value.title: Computer vision tech helps robots get a grasp on transparent objects
value.excerpt: In order to see and then grasp objects, robots typically utilize depth-sensing cameras like the Microsoft Kinect. And while such cameras may be thwarted by transparent or shiny objects, scientists at Carnegie Mellon University have developed a work-around.

value.title: Artie releases tool to measure bias in speech recognition models
value.excerpt: Researchers at Artie released a tool to detect bias in speech recognition systems. In a proof of concept, they find evidence of bias in a Google model.

value.title: Facial Recognition Is Everywhere. Here’s What We Can Do About It.
value.excerpt: You can opt out of facial recognition in some cases, but the history and future of the technology suggest we’ll need bigger solutions to its privacy problems.

value.title: MIT researchers find ‘systematic’ shortcomings in ImageNet data set
value.excerpt: MIT researchers say the influential ImageNet data set has "systematic annotation issues" when used as a benchmark for evaluating object recognition models.

value.title: Coping with inconsistent facial recognition in Apple Photos

value.title: Graphcore claims its M2000 AI computer hits 1 petaflop
value.excerpt: Chip startup Graphcore detailed its second-generation IPU and the M2000 AI computer, which the company claims can achieve up to a petaflop of compute.

value.title: Massachusetts Senate Passes Bill That Would Halt Police Use of Facial Recognition
value.excerpt: The Massachusetts state Senate approved a bill to revise police standards that would make the state the first in the U.S. to pause law enforcement’s use of facial recognition.

value.title: ‘Fundamentally flawed’ study describes facial recognition system designed to identify non-binary people
value.excerpt: In a study, researchers describe a controversial approach to designing facial recognition systems that can identify non-binary people.

value.title: OpenCV AI Kit aims to do for computer vision what Raspberry Pi did for hobbyist hardware

value.title: Supermarket chain Mercadona faces GDPR probe over facial recognition system
value.excerpt: Spanish supermarket chain Mercadona is under investigation by the country’s data protection regulator over the use of a new facial recognition system in 40 of its stores.
